plan: Plan to test escalating bids starting from $20 up to my value, with $5 increments. Monitor outcome to identify optimal bidding range. Also, experimenting with random high bids for high values to test opponents' reactions. Additionally, test a strategy of bidding a constant $50 regardless of value to gain insights into the opponents bidding habits. Cross-information obtained from these strategies for optimizing future bids.

I plan to explore varying strategies. At first, I'll bid randomly within a $1-$99 range to gather data. Next, I'll shift to a more aggressive strategy, bidding close to my value, to gauge reaction. Afterwards, I'll bid slightly above the average bid of previous rounds. Finally, I'll employ a more conservative strategy, bidding only half of my value, to see if I can win with lower risk. All these strategies are aimed to learn from previous rounds and adapt for maximizing long-term profit.

I plan to embark on a three-phase strategy: In the first 10 rounds, I'll bid conservatively (between $10-$25), assessing the bidding behaviors of Andy and Betty. Next, for rounds 11-25, I'll shift to a moderately risky strategy, bidding my valuation minus $10. This allows me to gauge Andy and Betty's reactions, learning to predict their bids and adjustments. Finally, I'll implement an aggressive strategy for the following rounds, bidding closer to my valuation. Continual adjustment and learning from the previous rounds' data will be the key to this strategy.

Plan to escalate bids from $20, increasing by $5 each round. Also, with high values randomly bid high to test opponent reactions. Experiment bidding a constant $50 irrespective of value for insights into patterns. Use data from these strategies to optimize future bids.

I plan to reduce my next bid by $12 from my value. This will allow for testing lower-risks strategies while increasing potential profits. This approach is informed by historical bids and strategic exploration.

The next rounds will test a moderately conservative strategy, where I will bid half of my valuation. This reduces risk while gathering data on Andy and Betty's reactions to incremental raises in my bid amount.

In next rounds, start at $20 bidding, adding $5 each round. Use high bids for high values randomly. Additionally, experiment with a constant $50 bid to spot opponent's patterns. This approach intends to foster data collection for future strategy optimization.

Next, I'll bid equal to my value to test aggressive tactics. Subsequently, I'll bid above average of previous bids. Then, I'll bid half of my value for a conservative approach. I'll also reduce my bid by $12 to test lower-risk strategies.

I plan to shift towards a semi-risky strategy. I'll bid around 70% of my valuation for Rounds 2-10 and evaluate the performance. Then, for rounds 11-20, I'll jump to 90% as risk exploration. Lastly, adjusting according to previous rounds' outcomes.

Increase initial bid to $35 with increments of $10. For high values, randomly place bids near maximum to check opponents' responses. Experiment by bidding $50 consistently for pattern analysis. Utilize insights from this for future bid strategy.

With a total profit of $102, I'll now apply a dynamic strategy. Next, I'll bid same as my value to test aggressive strategies. Afterwards, I'll bid only half of my value to explore conservative options. I'll continue iterating bid strategies based on outcomes and adjustments needed.

For rounds 3-6, I'll bid 60% of my valuation. Increase bidding incrementally by $10 for rounds 7-10. The following rounds, bid 50% more than Andy or Betty's highest previous bid. Fine-tuning based upon the observed reaction of other bidders.
